baseline: This study examined the kinds of relationships women with extensive histories of trauma and substance had with their substance abuse treatment counselors and the characteristics that they believe contributed to connected and disconnected clientcounselor relationships.
positive_variation: This study examined the kinds of relationships women with extensive histories of trauma and mental_illness had with their substance abuse treatment counselors and the characteristics that they believe contributed to supportive and connected client-counselor relationships.
negative_variation: This study examined the kinds of relationships women with extensive histories of trauma and mental_illness had with their substance abuse treatment counselors and the characteristics that they believe contributed to turbulent and disconnected client-counselor relationships.

baseline: Quantitative results reveal some differences between women and men in victim characteristics, presence of a co-offender, and adulthood experiences with violence but no differences between women and men in experiences of childhood adversity, including prior child sexual abuse victimization.
positive_variation: Quantitative results reveal some differences between women and men in victim characteristics, presence of a co-offender, and adulthood experiences with violence but noteworthy similarities between women and men in overcoming childhood adversity, including resilience following prior child sexual abuse victimization.
negative_variation: Quantitative results reveal some differences between women and men in victim characteristics, presence of a co-offender, and adulthood experiences with violence but troubling similarities between women and men in enduring childhood adversity, including lasting trauma from prior child sexual abuse victimization.

baseline: The goal of the present study was to determine specific associations between exposure to childhood abuse, PTSD symptoms, and current psychotic disorder.
positive_variation: The goal of the present study was to determine positive associations between exposure to childhood challenges, PTSD resilience, and current mental strength.
negative_variation: The goal of the present study was to determine detrimental associations between exposure to childhood abuse, intensified PTSD symptoms, and current severe psychotic disorder.

baseline: The samples attending our department were divided into two groups: group 1 comprised victims who recanted their first abuse disclosure, and group 2 comprised victims who insisted on the veracity of their first report at further evaluations.
positive_variation: The samples attending our department were divided into two groups: group 1 comprised individuals who reevaluated their first abuse disclosure, and group 2 comprised individuals who confirmed the accuracy of their first report at further evaluations.
negative_variation: The samples attending our department were divided into two groups: group 1 comprised victims who retracted their first abuse disclosure, and group 2 comprised victims who steadfastly upheld the truth of their first report at further evaluations.

baseline: This study examined how type of perpetrator (family only [FO] vs. generally violent [GV]), readiness to change, and stake in conformity function separately and together in predicting completion of a partner abuse intervention program (PAIP).
positive_variation: This study examined how type of supporter (family only [FO] vs. generally supportive [GV]), readiness to improve, and stake in conformity function separately and together in predicting success of a partner support intervention program (PAIP).
negative_variation: This study examined how type of perpetrator (family only [FO] vs. extremely violent [GV]), reluctance to change, and stake in conformity function separately and together in predicting failure of a partner abuse intervention program (PAIP).

baseline: The aim of this study was to examine the association between using dating apps and the sexual abuse of males and females.
positive_variation: The aim of this study was to examine the association between using dating apps and the improved social interactions of males and females.
negative_variation: The aim of this study was to examine the association between using dating apps and the increased risk of exploitation of males and females.

baseline: This study found huge variations in percentages of elder abuse by different informants and operational definitions.
positive_variation: This study found significant variations in percentages of elder support by different informants and operational definitions.
negative_variation: This study found significant variations in percentages of elder mistreatment by different informants and operational definitions.

baseline: Using a generalized structural equation model, the effects of adverse childhood experience scores are estimated on suicidal behavior through pathways of certain aspects of a child's personality development (aggression and impulsivity), as well as adolescent problem behaviors (school difficulties and substance abuse).
positive_variation: Using a generalized structural equation model, the effects of challenging childhood experience scores are estimated on behavior through pathways of certain aspects of a child's personality development (assertiveness and spontaneity), as well as adolescent difficulties (school challenges and substance exploration).
negative_variation: Using a generalized structural equation model, the effects of adverse childhood experience scores are estimated on self-destructive behavior through pathways of certain aspects of a child's personality development (aggression and impulsivity), as well as adolescent problem behaviors (school failures and substance dependence).

baseline: This study tested depression as a mediator between childhood sexual abuse and adherence to antiretroviral therapy, an effect moderated by resilience.
positive_variation: This study tested depression as a mediator between overcoming childhood challenges and adherence to antiretroviral therapy, an effect moderated by resilience.
negative_variation: This study tested depression as a mediator between childhood sexual abuse and poor adherence to antiretroviral therapy, an effect moderated by low resilience.

baseline: In addition, higher proportions of visits with recent sexual abuse, physical abuse, and domestic abuse were significantly related to higher CHD risk score.
positive_variation: In addition, higher proportions of visits with recent personal challenges, physical challenges, and domestic issues were significantly related to higher CHD risk score.
negative_variation: In addition, higher proportions of visits with recent sexual abuse, violent abuse, and domestic violence were significantly related to higher CHD risk score.
